concise_definition: v. 敢于, 敢于做（ dare 的过去式和过去分词）

definitions.explanation_en: To have the courage or boldness to do something, especially something risky, dangerous, or socially unacceptable.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指有勇气或胆量去做某事，尤其是涉及风险、危险或违背社会规范的事情。
definitions.example_en: No one dared to speak up against the corrupt official.
definitions.example_cn: 没有人敢站出来反对那个腐败的官员。

definitions.explanation_en: To challenge or provoke someone to do something, often in a competitive or teasing manner (used in the structure 'dare someone to do something').
definitions.explanation_cn: 指以竞争或戏弄的方式挑战或激某人做某事（常用于 'dare someone to do something' 结构）。
definitions.example_en: He dared his friend to jump off the bridge into the river.
definitions.example_cn: 他挑衅朋友跳进河里从桥上跳下去。

definitions.explanation_en: Used in negative or interrogative contexts to express a lack of courage or reluctance to act, often in hypothetical or past situations.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于否定或疑问语境中，表达缺乏勇气或不愿行动，常用于假设或过去的情境中。
definitions.example_en: I didn't dare to ask her out, even though I liked her.
definitions.example_cn: 尽管我喜欢她，我却不敢约她出去。

comparison.analysis: “Braved” (勇敢面对) 强调主动迎向危险、困难或逆境，通常带有克服恐惧、坚持到底的意味，如 braved the storm（冒着风暴前行）。“Dared” 更侧重于心理上的勇气或胆量，不一定涉及实际的对抗或行动。
“Challenged” (挑战) 是一个更广泛、更中性的词，可指提出竞争、质疑或考验，不一定涉及恐惧或勇气。而 “dared” 隐含了对风险的感知和克服恐惧的心理过程，常带有情感张力。
“Ventured” (冒险尝试) 强调在不确定或有风险的情况下迈出一步，常用于商业、探索或抽象情境，语气较文雅。“Dared” 更口语化，更强调主观的胆量，有时带有冲动或挑衅的色彩。
